newsitem.title: CANADA: CWB sells 150,000 T barley at $145 to Saudis - trade.
newsitem.headline: CWB sells 150,000 T barley at $145 to Saudis - trade.

text.p: The Canadian Wheat Board sold a minimum 150,000 tonnes of feed barley to Saudia Arabia at US$145 a tonne FOB Vancouver, trade sources said on Tuesday.
The CWB declined to confirm or comment on the tender.
Two ships loaded barley in Vancouver and a third loaded barley in Thunder Bay to supply Saudi Arabia, sources said.
"They must have sold a minimum 150,000 tonnes. These are all sold relatively cheap," a trade source said.
Saudi Arabia tendered on Monday for 450,000 tonnes of optional-origin barley to be delivered to Jeddah and 250,000 tonnes to Dammam, both by July 15.
"Canada's going to be in a better position to supply August, September. I think Europe's going to be the biggest participant on this one," another trade source said.
"It's to do with exportable surplus, we just can't provide three, four to five hundred thousand tonnes in that position," the source said.
The CWB tendered one 50,000 tonne May shipment contract last week to its accredited exporters.
"They made it available because they weren't making the sales to Japan. It's a better marketing ploy, it'll be US$145 FOB which is a nice return relative to other sales," he said.
